intro: Paulo-wilhelmia decaryi, commonly known as the Decary's ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the island of Martinique. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling ghostly apparitions due to their ethereal appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is considered a striking example of botanical beauty in the region.
